title: 103_s210
content: LIMITATION OF COST-OF-LIVING ADJUSTMENTS FOR PAY FOR MEMBERS OF CONGRESS AND CERTAIN SENIOR FEDERAL OFFICIALS. Members of Congress will have their annual pay rates adjusted based on the General Schedule rates under certain conditions. The adjustment amount will be rounded to the nearest multiple of $100. Members of Congress will have their annual pay rates adjusted based on the General Schedule rates, rounded to the nearest multiple of $100. The adjustment is determined by the percentage change in the ECI or the maximum percentage increase under the Social Security Act for the applicable year. The adjustment in rates of pay under the General Schedule takes effect at the beginning of the fiscal year. The first adjustment will be effective in 1995, with subsequent adjustments every 2 years based on the preceding year. Executive Schedule Officers' pay rates will also be adjusted accordingly. Effective at the start of the first pay period after the General Schedule pay rate adjustment, Executive Schedule positions will be adjusted based on the percentage change in the ECI, rounded to the nearest multiple of $100. The salary of the Vice President is determined based on the Ethics Reform Act of 1989 or the Social Security Act. The adjustment in pay rates under the General Schedule takes effect at the start of the fiscal year. The Vice President's salary is determined by the Federal Salary Act of 1967 and adjusted based on the General Schedule pay rates. The adjustment takes effect at the beginning of the first pay period after a rate adjustment under title 5. The Vice President's salary is adjusted based on the General Schedule pay rates, which are determined by the most recent percentage change in the ECI or the maximum percentage increase under the Social Security Act for the applicable year. The adjustment takes effect at the beginning of the fiscal year. SEC. 2. LIMITATION ON COST-OF-LIVING ADJUSTMENTS FOR FEDERAL ANNUITIES FOR MEMBERS OF CONGRESS AND CERTAIN SENIOR FEDERAL OFFICIALS. The Civil Service Retirement System is amended to limit adjustments for annuities based on service as a Member or in an Executive Schedule position. The adjustment will be the lesser of the percentage increase under this section or the maximum percentage increase under the Social Security Act. The adjustment for annuities based on service as a Member or in an Executive Schedule position under the Civil Service Retirement System will be the lesser of the percentage increase under this section or the maximum percentage increase under the Social Security Act. The adjustment for annuities based on service as a Member or in an Executive Schedule position under the Civil Service Retirement System will be the lesser of the percentage increase under this section or the maximum percentage increase under the Social Security Act. This subsection provides for the maximum percentage increase determined under section 215(i) of the Social Security Act for the applicable year.
